1063.question: What is the performance change of the textual semantic similarity task when no error and maximum errors (noise) are present?

5-Figure5-1.png: The performance of the textual semantic similarity task decreases as the percentage of error increases. Specifically, it goes from 0.88 with no error to 0.41 with maximum errors (noise).</s>

The performance of the textual semantic similarity task on the STS-B dataset decreases as the percentage of error increases. Specifically, it goes from 0.88 with no error to 0.41 with a maximum error of 20%.</s>

1063.answer:
10 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  60 points when error increase by 20%
50 Epochs: pearson-Spearman correlation  drops  55 points when error increase by 20%

1064.question: Which sentiment analysis data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced?

4-Figure3-1.png: The 'Results on IMDB Dataset' has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced, as it drops from 0.44 to 0.39, compared to the 'Results on MODB Dataset' which drops from 0.44 to 0.39.</s>

The 'Results on IMDB Dataset' shows a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced, dropping from 0.44 to 0.39, compared to the 'Results on MODB Dataset' which drops from 0.44 to 0.39 as well.</s>
4-Figure4-1.png: The 'SST-2' data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced, as its F1 score drops from 0.62 to 0.54, compared to the 'SST-1' data set which drops from 0.61 to 0.54.</s>
The 'SST-2' data set has a larger performance drop when a 10% error is introduced. The F1 score drops from 0.62 to 0.54, while for the 'SST-1' data set, it drops from 0.61 to 0.54.</s>
